stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Earthspirit 
[Gender] Female 
[Combat Experience] None 
[Place of Birth] Leithanien 
[Date of Birth] Apr. 5 
[Race] Caprinae 
[Height] 161cm 
[Infection Status] 
Showed physical signs of Originium poisoning, infection confirmed by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Normal 
[Mobility] Standard 
[Physical Resilience] Normal 
[Tactical Acumen] Standard 
[Combat Skill] Standard 
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Excellent

Earthspirit is a geologist. She fills the gaps we have in fields such as environmental assessment, battlefield analysis, and terrain utilization. 
She currently serves with a support squad performing geological surveys, early Catastrophe warnings and other related services for Rhodes Island.

Imaging tests for this Operator showed blurry outlines of internal organs with visible dark spots. Unusually high concentrations of Originium particles were present in her circulatory system, indicating infection and confirming her as Infected at this stage. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 14% 
Operator Earthspirit showed physical signs of crystal formation, with lesioned arms. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.31u/L 
Infection entering mid-stage, but still manageable.

Operator Earthspirit is dedicated to her job. When she lowers her head to study a stone, it becomes the entire focus of her world. The joke is that even if you replaced Earthspirit's lunch with a pile of red clay, she wouldn't even notice until the end of the work day. And as much as her efforts pay off and her research bears fruit, she still makes sure to stop working at the proper time each day. 
She is committed to maintaining a proper work-life balance by beginning and ending her research on time. Even since becoming Infected, she still keeps this commitment to what she considers a good lifestyle. Her professionalism and determination all stem from her personal approach to life, and she won't let anyone get in the way of that approach. 
Of course, there are times when it will be necessary to ask Earthspirit to work overtime, at which point we will have to pay her a substantial overtime bonus, as well as endure her eye rolling. 
Still, when you watch Earthspirit work, when you see her intense focus, and her meticulous appearance, you will know at once that she is one of the most professional Operators you could hope to meet.

As a geological researcher, her passion for rocks began when she was still in school. According to Earthspirit, studying the soil composition of samples from different eras will help us better understand the history of the land (she used at least four descriptors for the 'land' alone). The study of rocks is the most fundamental discipline in the field, and also the most important. 
Earthspirit's specialty is field surveys. She knows the formation, layout and history of all manner of different rocks and sediment, as well as what danger different forms of terrain could present to people. She never thought, though, that she would end up applying her expertise in battle.

Earthspirit became infected while collecting Originium samples in the field. She seems rather apathetic towards her infection, however, because it failed to enhance her connection to Originium or any other geological formation. In fact, it has turned out to be a major hindrance to her work. She completely trusts the course of treatment offered to her because she hasn't the time to worry about her affliction. 
To raise funds for her research, Earthspirit would also provide early Catastrophe warnings to towns and cities nearby while performing field surveys. Therefore making her a Herald of Catastrophe (despite her repeated insistence that it's only a second job, people still sought out her expertise).
Among the Herlads of Catastrophe, Earthspirit and Provence are friends (Provence still performs her duties as a Herald of Catastrophe while serving as a Rhodes Island Operator). Earthspirit also mentors volcanologist and fellow Caprinae, Eyjafjalla, on occasion.

According to Earthspirit, the hunk of Originium on her staff often speaks to her. Before arriving at Rhodes Island, it was unintelligible chatter. But now she finds she can understand some of what it has to say. 
Earthspirit finds this unnerving, but since her staff was custom-enchanted with Leithanian Arts and sonar projection added for geological surveys, she couldn't give it up. So she has to live with the voice and get used its chattering as part of her job. 
Since no one but Earthspirit can hear the voice and no other Operators have complained, treatment for chronic occupational stress-related tinnitus should be considered.

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.
<color name=#ffffff>EPOQUE Collection New Arrivals/Major Field. Practical yet dignified, it protects from the elements on field surveys, but can also be worn under a jacket for conferences.</color>

skills.desc: <@ba.vdown>Stops attacking</>; Enemies within range are <$ba.sluggish>Slowed</> every <@ba.vup>{interval:0.0}</> seconds

modules.desc:
Operator Earthspirit has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for impeding the enemy.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Supporter Operator during field operations to exercise Decel Binder responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

TO BE EXPENSED: Repairs + installing a music player on motorcycle
JUSTIFICATION: Motorcycle broke down. Also, would very much like approval for adding a music player.
OVERVIEW FROM ENGINEERING DEPT.: Fernand II 3-wheel motorcycle, manufactured before Battle of the Four Emperors, antique. Mr. Greypaw conducted fullbody inspection, says original parts hard to find because of age. Re safety: vehicle as old as this should be in museum, not speeding on roads. Greypaw explained this to Earthspirit, Earthspirit stated vehicle originally belonged to mentor Prof. Bachmann. Earthspirit oft. sat in sidecar holding boxes of stones, following mentor everywhere on field investigations. Prof. Bachmann gifted vehicle to her at graduation, and asked her to keep a promise. At present, Prof. Bachmann is deceased. Left only this Fernand II behind, always reminding Earthspirit not to forget promise. Earthspirit rides this motorcycle on vacation, sidecar usually filled with various stones when she returns, plus other Catastrophe Messengers hitchhike on occasion.
VIEW OF ENGINEERING DEPT.: Given special nature of Earthspirit's dept. plus direct superior of that dept. being the Doctor, this form to be passed onto the Doctor.

TO BE EXPENSED: Installation of suppressor for tuning fork
JUSTIFICATION: Sound has been bothering people more lately. Seemingly caused by Oripathy? Require installing an inhibitor for my tuning fork.
OVERVIEW FROM MEDICAL DEPT.: While true Earthspirit's Oripathy has grown severe, no others have heard this supposed sound she mentions. According to physical examination results, the worsening of Earthspirit's Oripathy seems to relate to her continued involuntary continuous usage of Originium Arts.
OVERVIEW FROM ENGINEERING DEPT.: Tuning fork is Leithanian, custom-order by Earthspirit's mentor for Earthspirit. Rhodes Island requires relevant tech documentation before able to commence investigation of how to limit its output rate.
VIEW OF ENGINEERING DEPT.: Given special nature of Earthspirit's dept. plus direct superior of that dept. being the Doctor, this form to be passed onto the Doctor.

LEAVE REQUESTED: Visiting home
LEAVE PERIOD: Apr 1 TO Apr 8
DATE OF REQUEST: Feb 24
APPLICANT: Glacier Wegenie
DETAILS: Haven't returned home in a long time. I would like to visit, given relative proximity to Leithanien soon.
VIEW OF HR DEPT.: Approved. Earthspirit was attacked by unknown assailants during a recent field mission, and is presently being treated in the Medical cabin. No adjustment of leave period required, as reconfirmed with Earthspirit. Additionally, Provence + Eyjafjalla will travel with Earthspirit, though given Provence has not returned aboard recently, we provisionally have not received her leave request.
*Given special nature of Earthspirit's dept. plus direct superior of that dept. being the Doctor, this form to be passed onto the Doctor.

missionList.desc: Have Earthspirit use Quicksand Conversion a total of 6 times (excluding Support Units)
Clear Intermezzo DM-2 with a 3-star rating; You must deploy your own Earthspirit, and only Vanguard and Sniper Operators are allowed for the remaining units

talents.name: Geological Survey

voice_lines.voiceText: Doctor, I've finished sorting the Originium from the other ores, as you requested. Is there anything else?
Oripathy is indeed troublesome. I can't even go on operations without approval from Dr. Kal'tsit. Oripathy shortens one's lifespan, you say? Yes, that's true, but I don't really mind.
This tuning fork? It's actually a staff — not only a weapon but also useful for geological surveys. I find it always comes in handy.
Without Rhodes Island, I'd probably still be a full-time geological researcher. And without you people... I'd probably already be dead.
What? I have dark circles under my eyes? Aw, I knew it…
What's that behind me, you ask? Well... ah, never mind, it's really hard to explain. I'll tell you when we have more time.
Some rocks talk to me, you know. They chatter and even squabble away. Sometimes, I lose sleep because of it… You think I'm kidding? Do I look like I'm kidding?
Provence is as careless as always. She needs to be careful or she'll end up like me, seriously ill. You'd better give her a good talking-to.

Astonishing...! Look at this, Doctor! This surface... it couldn't have been formed without high pressure in the crust three hundred and fifty thousand years ago. Isn't it incredible…? Guess what, Doctor? The theory is correct! Those who refuted it are the true fools!
Doctor—oh, you're sleeping? You must be tired from all your hard work.
I'm Earthspirit, a geology scholar and Caster, reporting in. I work eight hours each day. Make me work any more and you'll have to pay me extra.
Hm, is this academic data, or something else?
We must continue to refine our scientific method.
Forgive my bluntness, but do bear in mind you are paying me only a single salary. No matter how far you promote me, I won't do more than a single person's work.
Understood.
I hope this squad performs well in all types of extreme environment.
Don't worry, we'll be right back.
We can't let them misuse Originium like this.
Here.
What's the battle plan?
I'm ready.
Where are the enemies?
Sink into the earth!
The power of the earth...
This ends here!
You shouldn't have set foot here.
What the enemy was doing… would only bring disaster.
All enemies have been dealt with.
A fine victory, Doctor.
How is this possible…?
This environment is quite suitable for research.
Um...
This piece of ore is… for me? Really? But… it must be very expensive, no?
Arknights.

Take a look at the vast strata under our feet. Do you think they pay attention to the new year? Mhm, so neither do I. It's nothing more than an ordinary day off to me, so any tasks assigned to me will be treated as overtime, including attending any parties.
Doctor, time to get to work.

Happy birthday. This gemstone is for you. Very pretty, isn't it? I found it in the wilds after a Catastrophe had passed through. Does it confer good luck, you ask? Stones like these have already gone through countless arduous years of settlement and compression to become what they are. Asking it to control fate on top of that seems a bit much.

There are too many unsolved enigmas in my research, and I only have so much time. Thus, I have to maintain a clear boundary between work and life. So long as each finds its own separate meaning, my time on this land will be worthwhile. I count myself lucky to have found this balance at Rhodes Island.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the HR Office, HR contacting speed <@cc.vup>+30%</>
When this Operator is assigned to the HR Office, HR contacting speed <@cc.vup>+45%</> and Morale consumed per hour <@cc.vdown>+2</>
When this Operator is assigned to a Factory, <@cc.kw>Originium</> formula related productivity <@cc.vup>+35%</>
